SENT.plain: Acrocephalosyndactylias are syndromes characterized by abnormalities of the head (craniosynostosis), the face (hypertelorism, retromaxillism), hands and feet (cutaneous or bony syndactyly)
Inheritance is autosomal dominant, but spontaneous cases are described also
The group is divided into several syndromes with varying penetrance and expressivity
As an example of an acrocephalosyndactylia is the Pfeiffer syndrome presented
